title: 5 vitamins and minerals to boost your immunity | The Times of India
description: Vitamins and minerals are important for our body to stay healthy and reduce the risk of chronic diseases. They are nutrients essential for the growth of bones, muscles and skin, repairing cells and boosting immunity. We generally obtain them through our food as our body produces them in quantities that are insufficient for us.
cleaned_text: minerals to boost your immunity Vitamins and minerals are important for our body to stay healthy and reduce the risk of chronic diseases. They are nutrients essential for the growth of bones, muscles and skin, repairing cells and boosting immunity. We generally obtain them through our food as our body produces them in quantities that are insufficient for us. There are 13 different varieties of vitamins that our body needs namely vitamin A, B, C, D, E and K. Vitamin B can further be divided into B1, B2, B3, B5, B6, B7, B9 and B12 varieties. These vitamins have to be consumed in a balanced manner all through the year for you to be able to reap the benefits. Apart from food, nutrients can also be derived from supplements like vitamin C or D capsules. Supplements are generally taken when a person has a deficiency of a nutrient. It is best to obtain these nutrients from our diet so that one does not have to resort to supplements. [readmore](javascript://) 02/8Immunity boosting nutrients Our immune system is made up of cells and proteins which work together to defend our body from harmful microorganisms by developing antibodies against them and recognising them whenever they enter our bodies again. As important as it sounds, our immunity has gained even more importance in the times of the COVID-19 pandemic. One of the important roles of vitamins and minerals is to strengthen the immunity of our body and help to enhance its function. Following are some of the vitamins and minerals that you should consume to boost your immunity: [readmore](javascript://) 03/8Vitamin C Vitamin C is one of the most effective vitamins in boosting immunity. It helps us to prevent developing infections and fights them to shorten their period. Vitamin C can be found in a variety of foods ranging from citrus fruits to green vegetables. Here are some of the foods which can be consumed to obtain vitamin C: Citrus fruits like oranges and lemons Spinach, broccoli and Kale Strawberries and Litchis Papayas and Guavas Bell peppers The deficiency of vitamin C can cause scurvy. [readmore](javascript://) 04/8Vitamin A Vitamin A also helps us to fight infections and can be found in two types of food. Vitamin A is already present in many animals and animal products like meat and milk which can be consumed as part of our diet on a day-to-day basis. For vegetarians, it can be obtained from plant sources. Here are a few food items where vitamin A is present: Dark green leafy vegetables like spinach Potatoes sweet potatoes Colourful vegetables like carrots and bell peppers Yellow coloured fruits like papayas and mangoes Dairy products like milk, cheese and yogurt Meat Oily fish like Tuna The deficiency of vitamin A can cause night blindness. [readmore](javascript://) 05/8Vitamin D Vitamin D is beneficial for strengthening our immune system and is generated when our bodies are exposed to sunlight. Vitamin D is also important for the growth of our bones and teeth. The sunlight vitamin also functions more like a precursor to a hormone. While it can be obtained from sunlight, there are a few foods where it can be found: Oily or fatty fish like salmon and tuna Fortified milk Cheese Egg yolks Mushrooms Red meat Since it is found in few food items, people may suffer from vitamin D deficiency. They also may take vitamin D supplements to avoid a deficiency of the nutrient, but one should consult a doctor before taking them. Vitamin D deficiency can cause rickets. [readmore](javascript://) 06/8Vitamin E Vitamin E works as a powerful antioxidant in our body and helps to keep infections away. It also prevents clots from forming in the arteries of our heart. Vitamin E can be found in plant-based foods mainly in oils, nuts, seeds and a variety of fruits and vegetables. Some of the vitamin E rich foods are here: Almonds Peanuts Spinach Mango Bell pepper Sunflower and soyabean oil [readmore](javascript://) 07/8Zinc Zinc is a mineral that can be found in small amounts in our body. It produces new immune system cells and since it happens to be in small quantities, we should regularly consume zinc to boost immunity. It can be found both in plants and animals. Here are some of the foods that you can consume: Baked beans Dairy products like milk, cheese and yogurt Red meat Chickpeas and lentils Pumpkin, sesame, flax and hemp seeds Peanuts, cashews and almonds Eggs Grains like wheat and rice Potatoes [readmore](javascript://) 08/8The bottom line Consuming vitamins and minerals are important not only for boosting immunity but also for the proper functioning of our body. A well-balanced diet generally takes care of our nutrition needs but many people fail to do so which might lead to a deficiency of a certain vitamin or mineral. A variety of supplements are available in the market to bridge that gap but one should always consult a doctor to be sure of the dosage and duration.
